meanings.definition: A person or thing that promotes something alongside others.
meanings.sent1: The copromoters of the event worked together to spread the word.
meanings.sent2: The copromoters of the charity fundraiser collaborated to raise awareness.
meanings.sent3: The copromoters of the bake sale had a friendly competition to see who could sell the most cookies.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was like copromoters in a well-oiled machine, each playing a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The copromoters were like a dynamic duo, boosting each other's efforts.

meanings.definition: A substance that enhances the activity of another substance.
meanings.sent1: The copromoters in the fertilizer helped the plants grow faster.
meanings.sent2: Adding copromoters to the mixture increased its effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: The copromoters in the recipe made the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: The copromoters acted like a catalyst, speeding up the reaction.
meanings.sent5: The copromoters were like cheerleaders, cheering on the main ingredient.
